VLIB Function Reference

Object Detection

Introduction and Use Cases

Object Detection based on Haar feature along with multi scale ada boost classifier. Training of classifier is done outside the scope of these kernels, as it is required to be done only once. For a given scale for lower stages of classifier dense API can be used, for later stages sparse API should be used. These APIs can be used for pedestrian detection, face detection, or any specific object detection provided that proper trained classifier data is used for that class of objects.

Specification

Method

See the APIs of each function to see the method of each.

APIS

  • VLIB_haarDetectObjectsDense
  • VLIB_haarDetectObjectsSparse

References

  1. Paul Viola, Michael Jones. Rapid Object Detection using a Boosted Cascade of Simple Features. In CONFERENCE ON COMPUTER VISION AND PATTERN RECOGNITION, 2001.
